Name: Kuwait City
Description: The capital and largest city of Kuwait, known for its modern skyline, cultural landmarks, and bustling port.

Name: Hawalli
Description: A governorate located near Kuwait City, known for its commercial and residential areas.

Name: Al Farwaniyah
Description: A densely populated governorate that includes residential areas, shopping districts, and a major international airport.

Name: Mubarak Al Kabeer
Description: A governorate that includes several residential areas and cultural sites.

Name: Al Jahra
Description: A region known for its agriculture and desert landscapes, as well as its proximity to the borders with Iraq and Saudi Arabia.

Name: Ahmadi
Description: A governorate located in the southern part of Kuwait, known for its oil industry and industrial zones.
